posts.content:
I've been trying to make a strong fighter/WM with either cleric or paladin build for PVM with Divine Might/ Shield. Finding it quite difficult. Is this a viable build? It seems to stretch the ability scores too broadly to make a strong toon. I was even going to make this my first build that I've actually typed out but it isn't quite making the cut in the arena.

1) PvM
2) Level cap 20
3) Race preference: human
4) Class preference: What I've been trying is Fighter (6) to cover the feats needed then WM (7) then either Paladin or cleric. Paladin takes ages to get Divine Might and Shield whereas you can do it with only 2 levels of Cleric but then you don't get Divine grace. 
5) Melee preference - Trying to squeeze exotic and BS in there but might be better to go longsword. All the feats necessary for WM + power attack, cleave. Can't seem to squeeze blind fight in there. 
6) Range preference NA
7) Weapon preference - Bastard sword
8) Maximum item enhancement Up to +5 for most items
9) Spellcasting - No emphasis on casting as wisdom needs to stay low to get the necessary ability scores
10) Custom factors - can't think of any

Any ideas would be appreciated.

In order to get DM and DS with just 4 Pal, you need to take Pal 3 on a general feat level, skip 2 levels, then take Pal 4 on another general feat level. E.G.:

1- Pal (1) - Power Attack
2- Pal (2)
3- Pal (3) - Divine Might
4- Fighter (1) - Expertise
5- Fighter (2) - Dodge
6- Pal (4) - Divine Shield.

Particularly for this build, it doesn't really matter if it's Pal 5 / Fighter 8 or Pal 4 Fighter 9, since the level cap is 20. If you were to extend it to 40, then Pal 4 would be better, as you'd likely want a (few) fighter level (s) in epics for an (few) extra bonus feat (s).

But, let's leave it there for educational purposes anyway. Good hunting with this build!
